name: Newton Hotel and Highland Conference Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had 3 rooms, and two of them were on floor 2 facing the garden in the rear. Beautiful and comfortable. All rooms are definitely NOT the same in this hotel. The tour company gave us two double and a single room. My wife and I were in a large room with a high ceiling and crown molding, etc. Nice! The other double was nice, but a bit less, and the single was just a room. Everything was very clean, the hotel was beautiful, but if you stay here, tell them you want one of the nicer rooms. I don't know what else you could say, since the nice room we had wasn't really that much bigger or a suite or anything. It was just nicer. We had a nice 2 night stay.
reviews.title: Loved the place, but it is a long walk to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This place is not properly run and managed, even though the staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Not bad but good do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just a simple stroll around the park gives a fair idea of the state of affairs: no maintenance, ivy over growing and killing centenary trees... The same is true for the hotel.
reviews.title: Above and beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurant offers average and underwhelming food for dinner and the breakfast is a buffet as sad as some motels in Australia.
reviews.title: Lovely exterior promised more than it delivered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: As part of a tour group, we did not select the Newton Hotel in which to stay this past June. With that said, we couldn't have been more pleased with the Hotel and the wait staff. We would definitely stay again, given the opportunity. During our nine day tour, Ronnie was the only manager from all of the hotels we stayed, to hop aboard our tour bus and personally greet our tour group. Our room was comfortable, clean and large enough for the two of us, plus we had a view of the beautiful garden. A couple of days after leaving, I realized that I inadvertently left a blouse behind. I contacted the Newton and at their own expense they mailed my blouse to my home address. Thank you Elizabeth ! I'd rather stay at a warm, inviting, caring hotel like the Newton than a 5 star hotel where the staff only cares about themselves.
reviews.title: Good but a bit expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice rooms can't really compensate for the appallingly limited menu on offer. This hotel really only caters for conferences standard hotel guests are tolerated not shown care or consideration. This chain (Oxford hotel group) is a blight on good service. They also run the Craigellachie Hotel (badly)
reviews.title: fine for sleeping terrible for eating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Newton in Nairn, Scotland during our CIE Scottish Tour. This was an old Castle like hotel with beautiful grounds and period rooms. Antique furnishings, excellent bed and a wonderful, relaxing atmosphere. Deer and other wildlife abound. Great pub and Scottish breakfast. Terrific staff. Quiet and peaceful.
reviews.title: The Newton, Nairn, Scotland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was well presented, all the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was nice, the televisions are very dated and is the only reason I have not scored 5. Food was good. Overall a excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: Very dissaponiting afternoon tea. Had seen advert in local free mag. Lounge area where we were shown to in need of an upgrade, chairs and tables tired looking. Aft tea arrived very promptly but was immediately wishing i had gone eslewhere when it arrived on table. Sandwiches were ham and mustard, roast beef and mustard and cheese!! Also on cheap bread. Scones were hard and traybakes appeared bought in. I complained to waitress, who intimated this was standard and what would come out of kitchen again should it be returned and so we left! Poor effort Newton.
reviews.title: Very dissapointing aft tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a castle/mansion rebuilt in 1650 and 1950 when an addition was added to convert it into a hotel. We stayed in the old part in a beautiful room with a big bathroom. We wandered the halls in the evening and explored the open rooms which are now used for a variety of purposes--meeting rooms, a bar, etc. The castle is supposedly haunted which lends to the charm of the place. If the tall grass isn't too wet (it rains a lot in Scotland), you can walk out to see the 3 Highland cows: Haggis, Leaks, and Tatties. Also, read up on these national dishes, so you'll be familiar with them when you see them on the breakfast buffets every morning wherever you go! We had a great meal of haggis in the restaurant and met some of the friendliest staff ever. They made staying at Newton a lot of fun by making us feel so welcome.
reviews.title: Haunted Scotland (with charm)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really loved the two nights we stayed here the staff are welcoming and the hotel and rooms are clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic from start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in many hotels but I will say it is rare I find the food nice and worth eating with that said this is not the case for the Newton hotel. We ate here both nights because we enjoyed the food so much each night getting a starter, main and pudding :-) The first nights meal was included in the deal so we had it from the set menu and it was very tasty, but on the second night we picked from the bar menu and again it was fantastic...If this gets read please pass on our thanks to the chefs and also the dining staff they where really friendly, attentive and made us feel right at home and gave us a laugh now and then.
reviews.title: Great, relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The bar area was really nice and the barmaid was great really chatty and engaging with us when we where ordering our drinks and food on the first night...also I want to point out she knew how to pour a Guinness properly what a breath of fresh air.
reviews.title: Grand Old Hotel in Nairn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast both mornings was lovely the staff where attentive and welcoming and we didn't have to wait long at all for food, coffee, toast or anything really. Perfect in every way.
reviews.title: A Special place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now I saved the best till last, we had been to the highlands to at least see one highland cow and guess what they have two in the field within the hotel!!
reviews.title: Shocking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in a residential neighborhood, overlooking a large field with two cattle grazing, we found this hotel to be very nice. We were welcomed by the hotel manager before we were allowed off the bus. Only room that we had with two luggage racks on the entire trip. Large room with very large bathroom with heated floor. Multiple windows. Comfortable bed. Bathroom water pressure and temperature good. Reading lights by bed side had enough wattage.
reviews.title: 3rd Night of 8 night CIE Scottish Dream Tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our tour included a nice 4 course dinner, where we were able to taste freshly caught haggis for the first time. Tour included wine with dinner.
reviews.title: Definatley not a 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: After dinner the tour included entertainment with two high school age dancers (very good, I even tipped them as their mother picked them up after the performance), a bagpiper, and an accorian player. It lasted almost an hour and they left time for questions.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast ordered off a menu. Manager saw us off after breakfast. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Best experience in a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Booked an executive room as I thought we are old enough to treat ourselves now, expensive, £140 per night with continental breakfast but thought, yeh go on then. Staff were very friendly and seemed efficient, no complaints. The room was small, very shabby with bad staining on the carpet, Bed was rough and falling to bits and the decor was in desperate need of a lick of paint. The bathroom, i think, must have been tiled by a trainee who had obviously failed, broken toilet seat support, broken shower shelves, mould on the back of the soap bottles in the shower and the extractor fan clogged with thick dust, floor heating was restricted to approximately 3 tiles and a couple of the floor tiles were loose. i think £60 top whack would be more appropriate, the room number was 116, to be avoided.
reviews.title: Not new and well over a ton for a room on a Friday.

description: A delightful area in the Highlands of Scotland, the hospitality of the town is matched by the welcome that awaits guests at the Newton. Standing in 21 acres of mature parkland and gardens, yet close to the Highland Capital of Inverness, is the Newton Hotel. There are 56 en suite bedrooms and the hotel has a comfortable environment in which guests can relax. The hotel is only a 10-minute drive from Inverness Airport and within easy road and rail links, making it very accessible whichever way you choose to travel. The area hosts a wealth of attractions including the Malt Whisky Trail, Elgin Cathedral, Loch Ness, Cawdor Castle, Culloden Battlefield, the delights of Inverness or Nairn and the famous Moray Firth Dolphins.
